meanings.definition: A person who edits written material for publication.
meanings.sent1: The subeditors carefully checked for any mistakes in the article.
meanings.sent2: The subeditors made sure the article was error-free before printing.
meanings.sent3: The subeditors found a funny typo in the story and had a good laugh.
meanings.sent4: The subeditors are like detectives, searching for errors in the text.
meanings.sent5: The subeditors' job is to polish the writing until it shines.

meanings.definition: The act of editing written material for publication.
meanings.sent1: The subeditors' work involves refining the text for clarity.
meanings.sent2: The subeditors' role is crucial in ensuring the quality of the publication.
meanings.sent3: During the meeting, the subeditors playfully argued over grammar rules.
meanings.sent4: The subeditors' editing process is like sculpting a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The subeditors' attention to detail sets the standard for excellence.
